intro: Pharnaceum reflexum, commonly known as the reflexed pharnaceum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves that often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa and thrives in well-drained soils with full sun exposure. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
